text: I can't remember literally the accident
I remember a few about five or ten
minutes before and basically waking up
in hospital where a few months later and
I both broke both cheekbones top jaw my
nose
I'm fractured my skull as people say it
is totally life-changing I'm unable to
do certain things which I was able to do
which is frustrating just hoping that
obviously the I won't have to hide my
face away and my confidence within
myself will be back and I'll be able to
do just day-to-day things go and see
people walking the streets even just go
to any public areas really we're
producing guides metal guides at each
stage of the surgical process that we're
using not only to cut the bone using a
guide but also to reposition the bones
using a guide and then without removing
those guides we've also got custom-made
fixation plates that will be put into
gaps in the guide and fit to fix the
bones back together to reconstruct his
eye socket and then we take the guides
away Sean Peele design and research
engineer at the surgical and prosthetic
design group we've gone from doing just
medical models just replicas of Anatomy
through to reconstructing anatomy to
match healthy other parts of the body on
to planning surgeries in the virtual
environment producing surgical guides
that will allow the repositioning of
bones and the the exact placement of
drills and through to custom implants
that are tailored to each individual
patient I see the difference
straightaway as soon as they I woke up
from the surgery
I guess you straight away what sort of
change it done to me
I'm just glad in a way that they have
developed a sort of technology which
they are able to basically put me back
together in such a way which it is my
